channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Team USA wins its first medal of the Paris Summer Olympics
item.description: Divers Sarah Bacon and Kassidy Cook won the first U.S. medal of the Paris Olympics: a silver in the 3-meter synchronized springboard. It's the first time the U.S. has medaled in the event since 2012.
item.content:encoded:
Divers Sarah Bacon and Kassidy Cook won the first U.S. medal of the Paris Olympics: a silver in the 3-meter synchronized springboard. It's the first time the U.S. has medaled in the event since 2012.

(Image credit: Sebastien Bozon)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Sig Sauer guns hanging on soldiersâ€™ hips may be firing without trigger pull
item.description: On military bases from Virginia to the Middle East, pistols made by New Hampshire-based Sig Sauer have allegedly fired without a trigger pull, seriously wounding soldiers in some instances.
item.content:encoded:
On military bases from Virginia to the Middle East, pistols made by New Hampshire-based Sig Sauer have allegedly fired without a trigger pull, seriously wounding soldiers in some instances.

(Image credit: DAVE CHAN/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Todd Bookman

item.title: Opinion: Think you have a rough travel story? Try 52 days stuck in space
item.description: Two astronauts have been hanging out on the International Space Station since last month, waiting for the Boeing capsule that got them there to be repaired to bring them home.
item.content:encoded:
Two astronauts have been hanging out on the International Space Station since last month, waiting for the Boeing capsule that got them there to be repaired to bring them home.

(Image credit: MIGUEL J. RODRIGUEZ CARRILLO via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Athletes floated down the Seine at the opening ceremony of the Paris Olympics
item.description: The Paris Olympic opening ceremony delivered an amazing spectacle. Thousands of athletes floated down the Seine as more than 400,000 people lined the banks to take it all in.
item.content:encoded: The Paris Olympic opening ceremony delivered an amazing spectacle. Thousands of athletes floated down the Seine as more than 400,000 people lined the banks to take it all in.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Justice Department defends law calling for TikTok to change ownership or face ban
item.description: An update on the US government's new TikTok law. It aims to force the Chinese parent company to sell the app or face a ban.
item.content:encoded: An update on the US government's new TikTok law. It aims to force the Chinese parent company to sell the app or face a ban.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Week in politics: A presidential withdrawal, a historic week
item.description: From President Biden's announcement that he won't seek reelection to his Oval Office address, this week has been a historic one in presidential politics.
item.content:encoded: From President Biden's announcement that he won't seek reelection to his Oval Office address, this week has been a historic one in presidential politics.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: The Biden administration is wrapping up negotiations to lower prescription drug prices
item.description: The first price negotiations between Medicare and drug companies has been underway since February. What do we know about how it's going?
item.content:encoded: The first price negotiations between Medicare and drug companies has been underway since February. What do we know about how it's going?
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Trump almost won Minnesota in 2016. Could 2024 be the year the blue state flips?
item.description: Donald Trump and his vice presidential pick JD Vance campaign in Minnesota Saturday. The traditionally blue state may be competitive this year.
item.content:encoded: Donald Trump and his vice presidential pick JD Vance campaign in Minnesota Saturday. The traditionally blue state may be competitive this year.
item.dc:creator: Clay Masters

item.title: The Crowdstrike outage showed the vulnerability of the cloud
item.description: Experts say the services companies like Crowdstrike supply are in the hands of too few providers that are themselves too interconnected.
item.content:encoded: Experts say the services companies like Crowdstrike supply are in the hands of too few providers that are themselves too interconnected.
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr

item.title: Treasury Sec. Janet Yellen says the U.S. economy is growing within the ideal range
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen about recent indicators showing stronger-than-expected economic growth.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen about recent indicators showing stronger-than-expected economic growth.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
